caption.center: STATE OF MISSOURI, Respondent vs. FRANK GRAVES, Appellant.

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

date.center: Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied

opinion.opinion_text: [EDITORS' NOTE: THIS OPINION IS SUBJECT TO MODIFICATION OR TRANSFER TO THE SUPREME COURT.]
opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS, HONORABLE TIMOTHY WILSON.
opinion.attorneys:
Mary S. Choi, 1221 Locust Street, Suite 350 St. Louis, MO 63103, for appellant.Page 473
Jeremiah W. (Jay) Nixon, Attorney General, Breck K. Burgess, Assistant Attorney General, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before Clifford H. Ahrens, P.J., William H. Crandall, Jr., and James R. Dowd, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
Defendant, Frank Graves, appeals from the judgment entered after a jury found him guilty of assault in the first degree and felonious restraint. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion.
The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
